dialogues.text: He’s afraid we’re gonna get cracked. We owe these Russians money.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whacked. Not “cracked”, whacked. Jesus. And you owe Nikita Sokoloff money, probably the last guy on Earth you’d ever want to fuck around with. What were you guys thinking?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: I dunno. We weren’t. We just had all this money coming in. I mean, more money than we'd ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just pay them? Wayne starts waving his hands around.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Bees! Bees man! Bees! You hear them swarming?!? They sound like they're swarming!...Right?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: (re: Wayne) Shut the fuck up! And put your damn dick away! (To Jack) We were high. We figured, what’s the rush? I mean, everybody's friends, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, not with these guys.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Fucking bees, man!  63 40.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Wayne, I am telling you for the last time. Shut the fuck up! I can’t hear myself think!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man -- Buck grabs a remote control, FIRES IT off Wayne's head. He charges him and TACKLES him to the floor. A gruesome sight as Wayne's robe is entirely open as they roll around. Jack's eyes BULGE. He then calmly gets out of his chair and grabs a champagne bucket, filled with melting ice water. He throws it on the two men, dousing them. The guys SHRIEK, roll off each other, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Guys! Let's focus on why we're here. Jack sits in a CHAIR across from them, still on the floor. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: We're so fucking dead, aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. But you’ve got to clean up. And tell me everything.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - DAY 63 It’s an hour later. There is a brand new room service cart there. Buck has clearly convinced Wayne to eat. The situation appears to be calming down, as Buck and Wayne do their best to explain everything to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The amazing thing to me was that they had started a business that already could have made more millions than I could imagine in such a short time. Instead of paying, they hid out in a hotel suite, and spilled more coke than most people were capable of doing in a lifetime. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I figured that had they kept their shit together, for just the last two months, they might be worth millions. So maybe this wouldn’t be so tough to fix after all.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Look, you’ve got to take care of this Russian problem.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: First of all, I don’t have to do a God damn thing. Got it? Buck and Wayne nod, like children. Alright. I need to figure out what you did right. Obviously something because you made a million bucks in two months. I know what you did wrong, you didn’t pay your partners. And based upon what I see here today, I can safely assume that you don’t have the common sense that Christ gave a cockroach, on how to run a business.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: But you do, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: So, will you do that for us?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not so fast. I won’t make money by creating porn. I’ve got a family. I don’t have any interest in being a pornographer. If I’m going to come on, we will never provide porn again. (Thinking out loud) You guys figured out how to take a credit card from a person anywhere in the world and then deliver a product anywhere in the world, and neither side sees each other. Its genius, for sure. This is where the money is, long term. We just need to deliver the porn into homes all over the world, process the payment and take a cut.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  64 65 66 42.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I understand.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Imagine there's a basement, and in this basement there's a Chinese orgy...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. —- CHINESE ORGY - BASEMENT - TIMELESS 64 A room filled with ASIAN MEN and WOMEN, naked, getting it on. We see TWO ASIAN, yet Americanized MEN with spiky bleached hair filming...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And imagine you're guys who like to watch Chinese orgies...But how are you going to pay to see it? Are you going to give your credit card numbers to a group of Chinese pornographers overseas? And what would it show up on your credit card bill as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FARMER'S WIFE from the beginning montage opens the household credit card bill...

dialogues.speaker: C.U BILL....FILTHYASIANWHORES.COM
dialogues.text: The Farmer's wife's face boils with rage. She turns and sees her HUSBAND in his overalls. She walks up behind him and smashes him across the head with a frying pan.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The divorce rate is high enough in this country without wives having proof that their husbands are spending money on filthyasianwhores.com.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL SUITE - SAME 66 Buck and Wayne are like two mesmerized children, staring at Jack like he's a genius.  43.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: We could have hundreds of sites...maybe even thousands, all under some nondescript name?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Exactly, if I get a credit card bill and it says big tits dot com I may have some buyers remorse, but if it says software billing company, then who knows what that means. It’s safer for everyone concerned. Win / Win. Consumers get what they want, content providers get what they want and we make ten percent for handling the transaction.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, then we could take a cut from all of those people out there that are already making it. Be in the middle. Fucking middle men!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: It's limitless man, God damn limitless!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Potentially. We have no downside, other than your Russian partners.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Where does Haggerty fit in?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not so sure about Haggerty.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Why? He put us together. That would be kind of shitty to cut him out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look, he’s probably going to be indicted any time now. He’s got federal agents all over him.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: He told us he was never even going to be charged.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is already a questionable business. I don’t think it’s wise to team up with someone who is under investigation. We'll have federal agents all over us too.  67

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Look, what you’re saying makes sense. But I just don’t feel right about it. This guy’s saving our life.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Get something straight. I’m saving your life. I’m the one that’s gonna have to deal with these Russians, not Jerry Haggerty.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah but... Wayne looks at Buck, cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, ok, fine. We’re on board with you a hundred percent. Partners, right? As soon as you take care of this Russian problem. EXT. —- HAGGERTY’S HOUSE - DAY 67 The house is nice, far from palatial, but well kept. Jack rings the doorbell. Haggerty appears in the doorway. Jack slaps an envelope in Haggerty’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Two hundred thousand dollars. Now you’re out.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then I’m out. Give me back the money.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: No, no. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, I'll take the money. Jack nods and heads back to his car. Haggerty quickly takes half the money and shoves it in his pocket as he closes the door.  68 69 70 71 45. INT. - HAGGERTY’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM 68 Haggerty crosses the living room and heads for the kitchen. INT. —- HAGGERTY’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY 69 Ivan, the Russian who put the gun in Wayne’s mouth, sits at the kitchen table. He sips a vodka.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: He cut me out. Can you believe that shit? What a prick...how could he do that shit to a person? I mean, I knew he would, but it’s just so shocking when people are greedy like that.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: What did he give you?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: A hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls up outside the club in his car.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The next morning I flew back with Buck and Wayne agreeing that I was on board. Jack parks the car. He gets out heading for the club.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The deal was that we wouldn't provide a frame of content ourselves. We were just going to be middle men. INT. — CASABLANCA -— DAY 71 Jack disables the alarm. He makes his way through the empty club over to his office.  72 73 74 46.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told them to have Sokoloff contact me. These idiots didn’t even know how much they owed. Sokoloff’s guy called me and said it was a million bucks. INT. —- CASABLANCA, JACK'S OFFICE - DAY 72 Jack enters. There is a wall safe. He goes to it and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And they wanted it paid in three installments of four hundred thousand dollars. Inside is cash, lots of cash. At least a million dollars. He empties about half of it into a bag.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s more than a million bucks where I come from, but who was I to argue? Jack closes the safe and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out of the club, the money bag under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I remember feeling pretty good that morning. Maybe this was going to be the answer to my dreams. Diana and the kids would never have to worry about money again. And I would absolutely be out of this business in one year. It would be a tough year I thought, but the result would be worth it. Jack gets into his car and takes off. EXT. —- SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA - DAY 74 Various shots of the coast of San Pedro.  75 76 47. EXT. —- JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE - DAY 75 It's a beautiful place that overlooks the ocean. Ivan pulls up to the house in his black Mercedes. He gets out of his car and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Within an hour, some big Russian named Ivan was at my front door. Jack lets Ivan into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of the living room has an upscale beach house feel. Wayne and Buck sit on the sofa looking very nervous. Ivan instantly locks eyes with them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I’m not here to socialize.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m just trying to be friendly.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: We are no fucking friends. Where is my money?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your money? You mean Nikita’s money, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: He’s my Uncle. Our money. Family money that these two shit heads owe us. You pay this to me. Ivan glances at a framed photo of Jack and his son Michael.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or maybe I take this little boy for boat trip, no? Ivan picks up the picture frame. Jack clenches his jaw with contempt.  48. Jack opens the blinds to the deck revealing James, REGGIE and PEANUT with his very large, African American "wrecking crew". They stroll into the living room and quickly have Ivan surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I speak out of turn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let's focus on why we're here. Jack drops a duffel on the coffee table. Ivan picks it up. It’s stuffed with many packets of hundreds. Ivan does a quick count of a single packet. He scans the packets, counting, his lips moving as he WHISPERS NUMBERS IN RUSSIAN. Ivan nods, and then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Okay. This is good. Deal. Ivan reaches out his hand. They shake. As they shake hands, from out of nowhere, James punches Ivan square in the nose. We hear a crunch, blood flies everywhere. Ivan barely blinks as blood runs down his face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: James...what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: He threatened Michael. Peanut hands Ivan a bar towel.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Good punch. Now everybody is friends. Let us have that drink. Everyone starts LAUGHING and they head over to the bar. Buck and Wayne end up laughing along with Ivan...Ivan puts his arm around Wayne's shoulder. Jack grabs his cordless phone, hands it out to Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Maybe you should call your boss. Tell him that everything has been settled. Ivan looks reluctant.  49.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: This is okay. If I am happy. He is happy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's a lot of money. I'm sure he'd like to know it's been collected. And I think it would make my partners sleep better. Ivan takes the phone. He swallows hard, nervously. Jack stares at him skeptically for a moment. Ivan dials...puts the phone to his ear. After a moment Ivan suddenly relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: It is machine. Ivan clicks off the phone and extends it back to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh. I guess we'll try again later. As Jack grabs the phone he feels it is wet. Jack looks down and sees his fingers are stained with blood. So is the phone. Jack looks up at Ivan. Blood is trickling down from Ivan’s ear. Jack is suddenly terrified, even though Ivan seems to be doing very well with his arm around Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I like you! You always make me laugh! We're friends now.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're friends, right! Right? Jack nudges James and motions with his chin towards Ivan’s ear. James’s face changes instantly. As Ivan is talking to Wayne, his eyes roll up in his head. He begins to slur his words as blood and puss pour from his ear. He collapses to the floor, foaming from the mouth. His right leg kicks violently, smashing the coffee table to bits. Wayne stares in shock.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you do, Wayne?!? Jack and James rush over and check his pulse.  77 78 50.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is he dead? James nods "yes".

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How hard did you punch him?!?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Jack. I just punched ‘em like I always punch ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You ever hear of a jab?!?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Oh shit. We are so dead... We're dead, right? I mean, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shit, I'm sorry Jack. Jack says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, James, and Peanut are tossing Ivan'’s body, wrapped in a large tarp and chains, off the port bow. Jack is clearly white as a ghost. Buck and Wayne peer on from across the deck, like two petrified children.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: James is driving the boat back towards the lights of San Pedro. He and Peanut take pulls on a bottle of Hennessey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Jack is drinking too, staring off into space, listening to the sounds of the engines. Buck sits across from him at the table, while Wayne paces in the background.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What do we do?  51.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We don’t do anything. We don’t mention this to anyone. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What about the money?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We gave it to him.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But they don’t know that. And that’s the way we need to keep it.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Dude, you're not getting it. You’re just not getting it. They didn’t get their money.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As far as we're concerned, they did.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We gave them the money. He disappeared with it. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: But what if they still want it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We do what we would do in that circumstance. We tell them to fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no. These Russians are nuts, man. They’ve kicked our asses twice already.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: I say we just pay them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No! We're not going to pay them twice!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: But we didn’t even pay them once!  79 80 81 52. Jack erupts.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They don’t know that! If we’re too eager to pay again, they’1l smell a rat! They’11 know we did something to him!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: How do you figure that? Just pay them and they’1ll go away!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s not like you can’t afford it. You still have the money...Right? Jack gets up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look, I've made it as clear as I know how. We’re done talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane touches down on the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A town car pulls into the driveway. It stops and Jack gets out of the back, carrying his bag. The car pulls away. He stares at the place like it’s a sight for sore eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters. The house looks much as we last saw it. Diana appears with open arms.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey honey. Jack hugs her, a little longer than usual. She picks up on it. She pulls back and stares him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay? He breaks the hug.  53.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. I missed you so much.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So what's this new business in California?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Never mind that right now. Jack’s children, Adam and Michael, run into the room.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Daddy! The kids run and attach themselves to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey gang. Jack looks to Diana.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go out to dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Anywhere you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fancy restaurant sits on the banks of the Gulf of Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow a WAITER who carries a tray of seafood and fish to Jack's table. At the table is Jack, Diana, Adam and Michael. The waiter sets the food down before them. Jack stares blankly at his broiled fish, the head still attached. He turns away, clearly having a bad thought. Looking out at the Gulf doesn’t help. He’s suddenly a million miles away.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m fine.  54. Jack glances over to Michael, who is dumping ketchup on his french fries. It looks like blood. Jack takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Daddy, what do fish eat?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Some eat plankton, some eat other fish.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: They eat whatever’s around. ANGLE ON JACK, his mind is racing.

dialogues.speaker: JUMPCUT TO
dialogues.text: A SCHOOL OF RAVENOUS FISH ARE HAVING A BUFFET ON IVAN’S

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Jack! Are you sure you’re okay?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m just not that hungry. 85 INT. - JACK’'S MODEST HOUSTON HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT 8 Jack and Diana lie in bed. It’s late. Diana stirs, coming out of a troubled sleep. She doesn’t even have to look at Jack to know...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're awake aren’t you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I know you better than you know yourself. What is up with you?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Just business.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Are you sure?  55. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look, I’m gonna have to go back in a few days. It's a very new business. Once I get it up and running, I promise you, I'll be spending most of my time at home.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I hope so. I'd hate to lose you to California.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's one of these new Internet businesses...you know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Not really. I don't know anything about Internet businesses.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They just take a lot of commitment.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So do marriages. He nods, takes her hand. They kiss. Then passionately. INT. - JACK’S CAR - DAY 86 Diana is driving Jack to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So what kind of business is it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I told you. It's an Internet business.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. What kind?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s a billing service.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh. For what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What do you bill people for?  56.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Entertainment...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh? What kind of entertainment?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Movies, pictures and stuff... Diana looks at him skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're not telling me something.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Fine. Adult movies. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not joking. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jack be serious...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Diana.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're really not joking?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Relax, I’m not making porn movies. It’s an Internet billing service.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Internet billing service? I don't even know what that means, Jack. You bill people on their computers?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah Diana, computers.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.  57.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I think it’s the gold rush, Diana. It could set us up for life in less than a year.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well, I think you're crazy and it’s completely disgusting. And I don’t want you doing it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What about Steve Wynn or Baron Hilton? Are they pornographers because they have these films in every one of their hotels?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don’t care about them, I care about you, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Diana, I'll be out in a year.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to be a part of this at all. Not even for a day.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh Diana, c'mon. We watch the damn things once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't care! This is disgusting, I don't like it, and I don't want you doing it! End of story, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Little did she know it was already too late... 87 EXT. -— GEORGE BUSH INTERCONTINENTAL AIRPORT - DAY 87 Jack gets out of the car. He kisses Diana, heads for the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn’t back out now. I mean, I could just imagine the damage that Buck and Wayne would do on their own. They were the kind of guys who would get pulled over for a DUI and start confessing to some motorcycle cop about the murder. I had to keep an eye on them somehow. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd either end up arrested, or worse yet, dead by the hands of the Sokoloff's. EXT. —- LAX RUNWAY - DAY 88 The plane touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks out of the terminal. James is there, standing in front of a town car.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So I go back to LA with my wife’s words rolling around in my head. I’m not in town two minutes and the shit hits the fan. Nikita and a few of his goons stand by a waiting car. They motion for Jack. Jack eyeballs them and forces his best smile.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew if I didn’t play this perfectly, I'd be joining Ivan. Jack walks over to the Russians. James grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don’t like this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s cool. James bends down to take Jack’s luggage, getting in his way. Jack puts a calming hand on James’s shoulder. James straightens up with the bag.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (quietly) I’m telling you, I don’t like this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s alright, I'll go with them. I'll meet you back at the house. Jack turns and heads for the Russian’s car.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, this is nice...thanks.  90 91 59. Jack gets in the back seat with Nikita and the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE and PEANUT are in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fuck this. We're following him. James quickly peels away from the curb. INT. — NIKITA’S CAR - DAY 91

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I hope you guys don’t take this the wrong way, but my guess is you didn’t do this just to be nice.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Tell me about Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ivan...what about him?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: What happened exactly?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. What happened with what?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Was he was at your house?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Of course he was at my house. Why?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not following you. We had a bunch of drinks. We laughed a lot. Then he left. Nikita nods.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you gonna tell me what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Ivan never got home.  92 60.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay. So he’s out partying somewhere. Nikita stares at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Hey, I gave him the four hundred thousand we agreed to, plus fifty for your troubles.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Four fifty. I gave him four fifty.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: The figure was two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That’s not what he told me. I paid him exactly what he asked for, plus some.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: So what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not saying anything. What is he saying by not showing up with your money? Because it looks like he ripped you off. Nikita backhands Jack across the jaw. The driver begins talking to Nikita in Russian. We don’t need a translator to realize this isn’t good.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Next time, leave your dogs at home. Jack turns, looks out the window to see James following.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Reggie and Peanut follow. As they approach a light, the Russian's suddenly gun the car. It takes off through the intersection as the light turns to yellow.  93 61.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shit... James slams his foot down on the gas as the light turns red. People begin crossing the street. They scream as James swerves to his left, narrowly missing them. Now they're in the intersection. Cars slam their brakes from every direction, horns blaring. They're boxed in.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is led out of the car by Nikita and the goons somewhere on the outskirts of LAX. Jets scream overhead as they come in for landings just a few hundred feet above. Everyone has to shout over the noise. The goons have their guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Tell me one more time. What happened between you and Ivan?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can go over this a million times. My story's not gonna change. He came to the house, I paid him, he ripped us off. The Russian's begin shouting. They clearly want to kill Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: guns) This is a bad play, Nikita. I'm supposed to be your partner. You're gonna whack me over some shit I didn't even do? What are you gonna do when Ivan turns up and you realize you've pissed away a whole bunch of money we could have made together?

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Fuck you! He whistles to his partners to pull the trigger. Instantly, everything shifts. James, Reggie and Peanut have them surrounded, guns drawn. Everyone begins screaming at once, jets thundering overhead. It's a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Put the fucking guns down!  94 62.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fuck these Russian motherfuckers! It's mass confusion.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's focus on why we're here...this is about money, right? Come up with a number. What's the number that squares this thing? Nikita thinks.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Double my end, pay every month. No matter what. No excuses. Everyone slowly begins to lower their guns. Nikita walks over to Jack. He cups his face with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if I find out you lied to me...I'1l kill you, your family, your friends, people you haven't even met yet. We understand each other? Jack nods. Off his face, the screen burns to a HOT WHITE. INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES - DAY 94 A small warehouse has been converted into an office. A dozen computers and A DOZEN WORKERS...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once Nikita was handled, it was back to business. We started with just a small warehouse and a couple of small servers...We had about 20 different sites after the first couple of months... PAN ACROSS the COMPUTER MONITORS as WE SEE THE PAGES OF VARIOUS DIFFERENT SITES...  95 96 97 63.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: However, we were so quick in paying out our content providers that we started to get new inquiries from potential clients every day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBIN SWALLOW, 37, the hottest MILF in the business and her exclusive partner ALEXANDRA RAYNES, 27 enter the board room scantily clad to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is what an inquiry looked like. After a few months it looked more like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DOZEN DIFFERENT PORN-STAR CHICKS AND THEIR STUDS are seated in a waiting area, all various types. MILF'S, BONDAGE COUPLES and ALL NATIONALITIES are equally represented. WE HEAR AT LEAST FIVE DIFFERENT LANGUAGES BEING SPOKEN...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The money began to pour in. And I tried to teach Buck and Wayne how to be smart with it, to always re-invest in the company first. But they never seemed to get it. INT. - SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, BUCK’S OFFICE - DAY 97 Jack opens up a drawer. There’s a check for two million dollars stashed under a stack of candy bars. Jack turns to Buck and Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you guys retarded? This is two million dollars! And you've got it stashed under some fucking candy bars!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Sorry dude.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Just relax, right?  98 99 100 64. INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, WAYNE’S OFFICE - DAY 98 Jack is sifting through mail, magazines. There is a stack of old mail on Wayne’s desk. He picks it up and opens the envelopes. His eyes bulge. Wayne stands in the doorway bullshitting with some employees.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey Wayne, you’ve got a bunch of checks here. This is like seven million dollars!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Dude relax. You’re complaining about money coming in?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: These checks have been on your desk for weeks!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Dude, take a pill, right? INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES - DAY 99 It's a bigger operation now. WORKERS moving to and from offices and cubicles...NEW SERVERS are being brought in. Jack sits in his office. Across from him sit Robin Swallow, Alexandra Raynes and their business manager, a normal looking guy in a suit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of course we also invested in our relationships. Relationships in this world meant everything. He and Robin shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And at home too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jack’s palace from the beginning of the movie. Moving trucks sit outside it, parked next to two Mercedes and a Bentley. DIANA AND THE KIDS rush to Jack as he arrives in his limo. He brings presents for the kids. Hugs all around.  101 65.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every trip home was like this wonderful homecoming...And I always made sure to bring presents... Sometimes for the kids... Jack holds his hands over Diana's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And sometimes for Diana. Jack removes his hands, revealing a GIANT DIAMOND TENNIS BRACELET. Diana can't believe her eyes. She smiles and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now and then she'd complain about the business I was in or that the new house felt so cold and empty without me. Everybody thought our relationship was strange but it was just fine. Absence did indeed make the heart grow fonder. And over time she seemed to adjust to me being gone so much... The screen once again burns to a HOT WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DOZEN BEAUTIFUL WOMEN now walk with the guys across the tarmac. James and his SECURITY TEAM are surrounding them with suits on, earpieces in and walkie-talkies...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As we became more successful, everything became a bigger look for us, our parties, our lifestyle... PULL OUT TO REVEAL TWO GULF STREAM JETS WAITING FOR THEM.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't even about being smart...You just had to be fun and you'd draw more and more sites which meant more and more money which meant bigger planes, bigger buildings...  102 103 104 105 66. EXT. -— SOFTWARE BILLING BUILDING - DAY 102 Jack, Wayne and Buck cut the yellow ribbon surrounding their new giant software billing facility.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bigger cars... Jack leaves the lot in a limo. Wayne gets in a Bentley. Buck hops in a giant custom TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bigger houses... EXT. - BUCK AND WAYNE’S PALATIAL ESTATES - DAY 103 Establishing shot of Buck and Wayne’s enormous houses.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...And of course bigger egos. INT. — CASABLANCA NIGHTCLUB - NIGHT 104 Wayne and Buck are standing on top of a table throwing HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS "making it rain" out to all the GUYS AND GIRLS dancing around them. Jack nods in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are at the AVN awards. It’s the equivalent to the Academy Awards for porn. It’s a real red carpet event with a parade of producers, directors and porn stars. Jack looks into CAMERA. He is being interviewed. In some ways he’s a different person. Impeccably dressed, oozing money and power. He’s clearly become a rock star.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What I think we’ve done better than anyone is match the product, which is on one side and make it more accessible to the consumer who is on the other side. We keep the entire interaction discreet and professional. We never forget for one moment that this is a business. And like all businesses we exist by satisfying both our content providers and our content subscribers.  106 107 67. OVER A PARADE OF IMAGES OF PEOPLE ON THE RED CARPET...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You know the more time you spend around all this stuff, the more normal it becomes. It’s a world without any filters. It may be crass and in your face, but there is something incredibly honest about all of it. The outside world becomes increasingly strange and lame. You know that most of the outside world is looking down their nose at you, but you also know at the same exact time, if they were really honest with themselves, they’d kill to be on the inside with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack talks to Robin and Alexandra. They are both holding hands and are clearly an item. Robin spots someone.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Hey, did you meet Audrey? Jack turns. It’s like he’s been punched in the face. Across the room he locks eyes with AUDREY DAWN. She’s a combination of smoldering heat and girlish charm.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After all these years, everyone knew I was a family man. But the second I saw her, I knew I was in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Audrey sit off to the side away the action.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So, you’re the talk of the town...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I am? What are you talking about? You are. You're a rockstar. Everybody knows you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Everybody knows you, Audrey Dawn.  68.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Do you like that name? Audrey Dawn?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I made it up. I think it sounds happy. You know, a good time had by all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How'd you get into this business?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: It’s a long story...but I’m having fun. Certain people are just good at certain things. I’m good at all kinds of things, and I’m not ashamed of it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Apparently not.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I think there’s just too much emphasis on guilt. All this guilt, guilt, guilt. Guilt for what? I’1l bet if you ask any old timer in one of those old folks homes, they’d tell you they regret the stuff they didn’t do. Not the stuff that they did do. Jack listens.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'd like to be in business with you.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’m not like your other sites. I only do solo girl, just me, which seems to be enough. On screen anyway...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I keep getting ripped off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That won’t happen with me.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Any chance you can get all the money that’s been ripped off from me so far?  69.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. But whatever you’re owed, I’1l pay you that figure up front, if you come on board. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Come on board? Good title. 108 EXT. — PATIO - NIGHT 108 Jack steps outside to get a breath of fresh air. The lights of Vegas glisten in the background. A few people mill around. Suddenly, Jack spots Haggerty, who stands almost in the shadows, talking to a young porn starlet. Haggerty excuses himself and moves over to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Hey Jack. Things seem to be going well for you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah Jerry. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: I have clients in all kinds of businesses Jack, you know that. Haggerty lights up a Cuban cigar and blows a perfect smoke ring. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) Why did you cut me out?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I didn’t cut you out. I paid you two hundred grand up front, before I even knew if there was a deal, didn’t I? Haggerty smiles and looks all around.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But look at all the money you’re making. All the money... and no Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come on Jerry, you’re under indictment.  70.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Oh that’1l never stick Jack. You know I’m too smart to end up behind bars. Jack nods. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) I thought you said you'd be out ina year.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I never said that.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Sure you did. To the morons. They like me Jack. I’m like a father confessor to them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well everybody needs a church of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this isn’t like you. Why are you still around? It can’t be because of the money. You’re not greedy Jack. We both know you’ve already made enough. And it sure isn’t the pussy. You're a married guy Jack. I mean I guess that’s not saying much by today’s standards. But you’re like a throwback, an actual faithfully married man. So what is it? What’s keeping you around?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just enjoy the party and stop thinking so much. Haggerty laughs. There’s hidden meaning to his laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Oh, but I just can’t help myself. I love to think. I love hearing my brain go clickity clickity click. Jack nods and moves past him. Haggerty follows him inside. Jack moves over to Audrey. They begin to talk business. Porn starlets begin to gather around the conversation. It's obvious, they are the center of attention.  109 71. Jack spots Haggerty talking with Buck and Wayne. It clearly bothers him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had a real problem with Haggerty. The only reason he would tell me that he, Buck, and Wayne still talked, is to put some kind of fear into me. But how much did he know? Buck and Wayne couldn’t be stupid enough to tell him about the dead Russian? Or could they? I mean could anyone be that stupid? ANGLE ON Buck and Wayne, who watch from the other side of the room, with little attention being thrown their way from ANYONE at the party.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: You ever get the feeling this partnership ain’t such a real partnership?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: He’s like Mick Jagger, and we’re like a couple of roadies.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s how he treats us. Like we're roadies, right?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Oh, relax. We’re rich, aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, they were rich, alright. But somehow guys like Wayne always think all their shit is going to be taken away from them. INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES - DAY 109 It’s colossal now. Workers moving to and fro. Wayne is sneaking around the office, clearly up to something, looking over his shoulder like he is about to commit the crime of the century. He sneaks into the men’s room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I mean, here’s Wayne, worth well over thirty million dollars in no time at all, and this dumb bastard is stealing toilet paper from the office.  72. INT. —- SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, MEN’S ROOM - DAY 110 Jack is on the toilet reading the Wall Street Journal and taking a crap. He reaches over to the toilet paper dispenser. There’s nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jesus... With his pants around his ankles, he begins checking cabinet after cabinet. There is nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck! RESUME PARTY... Haggerty steps into frame. Haggerty walks a few feet away and taps DENNY Z, 30, on the back. Denny Z is thin with greasy black hair. If Ichabod Crane was a pornographer, he’d be Denny....

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Denny Z was a bottom feeder and a complete scumbag. The kind of person you'd be embarrassed to spend time with. In this business, that’s saying a lot. Haggerty walks Denny over to Buck and Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He was also the kind of guy, that after you shook his hand, you wanted to boil yours. Denny shakes hands with Buck and then Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is the legendary Denny Z...One of the best producers out there. His site is something you should really look into.

dialogues.speaker: DENNY Z
dialogues.text: I have some real interesting ideas on the site's future, man. I want to set up a sick-ass portal for my premium members, fucking cutting edge shit man.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: I like what I'm hearing so far...  73.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Me too...That's brilliant, right?

dialogues.speaker: DENNY Z
dialogues.text: I haven't even told you anything.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Fuck the details, let's make a deal! Denny smiles. That was easy enough. They all shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's club is packed to the rafters. Music is blasting, people are dancing. ANGLE ON: a private section. The VIP lounge. Jack sits on a sofa sipping a bourbon. Audrey sits next to him, a dirty martini with three olives in her hand. James stands above the table. James and Jack clasp hands. James sits with them.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Good to see you back.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s good to be back.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Like old times. (to Audrey) I remember him before he was such a big shot. He was just a little shot then. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How'd you get this place?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, I’m living in Houston and I get a call from a friend to take over for a while because he got ill. I came out here and very quickly figured out that everybody was ripping this place off. I fired a whole bunch of people and turned the place around, my friend couldn't work any more, so now its mine..  74.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Not surprising.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: With a club you’ve got to keep your eye on everything. It’s a cash business and everyone’s looking to rip you off.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That's why he’s got me. See if anybody steal’s from him, I go and kick their ass. I can’t have any crooks or thieves around here, because I’m too busy stealing from Jack myself. They laugh again. James spots the bartender pocketing a few dollars.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: bartender) Like that motherfucker right there... James gets up.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. James heads off towards the bar.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So let me guess, you start to spend less and less time at home. Your wife and kids become strangers to you, and now you find yourself lost and confused with a twenty three year old pornstar. Accurate?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You make it sound so cliche.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Well it is, isn’t it? It’s the oldest story in the world. It’s a carbon copy of my house growing up. Absentee father. Working all the time. A self obsessed mother. Fifty, trying to look twenty five. Cocktails at noon. Eight vicodins a day. Her idea of a well rounded conversation usually consisted of deep questions like, “Do I look puffy?” Jack laughs. Suddenly there is a commotion over by the bar.  75. ANGLE ON: James roues the bartender, lifting him up by his shirt. The bartender pleads with him.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: It was a tip! I swear, it was a tip! James looks around at everyone in the bar. All eyes are on them. James slowly puts the bartender back down onto his feet and cleans him up. We go back to Jack and Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I keep waiting for that inevitable question.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What question is that?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh, you know. How did I choose this line of work? How did a beautiful girl like me who's obviously smart, jump into the porn business with both pumps?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, since you brought it up...yeah, I’m curious.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I was a tech geek, going to college to be a software engineer. Trying to get as far away from my mother as possible. I could build websites better and faster than anyone. Some of my girlfriends and I stripped on the side to put ourselves through school and then one of them asked me to build her a website. So I did. When I saw the money that she made from it I knew it was the "goldrush"...I had to jump in. I would do almost anything for money to make myself independent. It was a very easy decision. Jack looks at her, realizing that Audrey has an eerily similar story to his own.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wow...a tech geek?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’ve got an IQ that tests off the charts. No bullshit. I’m in MENSA.  112 113 76.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Impressive. Audrey smiles and sips her drink. She looks at Jack. She leans over to kiss him. Jack resists.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? She leans in again and Jack gives in. They start kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana’s car drives along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana drives Jack home from the airport. Jack looks stiff as a board, GUILT RIDDEN. Both of them have obviously been quiet for a long time, when Diana breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're quiet... Jack says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like I said... Jack gazes out the window, saying nothing, until...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You know, when I was a kid, we were broke all the time. I know I’ve told you this a thousand times, but lately, I’ve been thinking a lot about my father. He always put food on the table, but I knew, even as a little kid, he was making miracles happen. That everything he was doing, came from this minute by minute kind of thinking. He had no education and no fear.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well, you seem to survive well, ina chaotic universe. Jack nods.  114 77.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that’s one of my talents.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: And the other talent you've got is to create a big mess so you feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You’re so much better than this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What am I doing wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's just so horrible that I can’t tell people what you do.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And why is that important to you?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It’s not important to you? What about our children? How do you think they’re going to handle it? When they find out what their daddy does?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
