dialogues.text: Fine Diana, do whatever you want. I won’t argue with you. I know I’ve got it coming... He slowly turns and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So after that lovely scene, I headed back to LA. INT. — JACK'S SAN PEDRO HOUSE - BEDROOM - MORNING 97. 141 Jack and Audrey are in bed, her head on his chest. Jack’s cell phone rings. Jack picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: vean? (into phone) eah? INT. — JACK'S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT Diana is on the other end of the phone. She’s upset.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Our son has been arrested!

dialogues.speaker: AS NECESSARY
dialogues.text: Jack sits up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Our son has been arrested!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Why? What do you mean? What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m on my way. EXT. — PRIVATE JET - DAY 143 The jet sails through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is seated on the plane, staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was on my way to Houston within an hour. It turns out that Michael, my oldest son, didn't like a few of his grades so he hacked into the school's computer system and changed them to his liking. INT. —- DEAN'S OFFICE - DAY 145 Jack and Diana sit opposite DEAN LOOMIS, the headmaster of the school. They are both extremely animated.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So Diana and I went to see the head of the school, Dean Loomis. After some intense discussion and a generous donation towards the school's new gymnasium, we finally convinced him to drop the charges against Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is yelling into the phone. Diana sits nervously in the background.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But that wasn't enough. It turns out the Houston DA was looking to make an example of my son, and was proceeding with the charges regardless. EXT. -— HOUSTON CITY HALL - DAY 147 Jack walks into the building carrying a briefcase.  148 149 99.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So I decided to pay him a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks past the secretary.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. Jack goes into the office anyway, the secretary running after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks right in and sits down opposite the DA, FRANK GRIFFIN, briefcase at his side. The secretary comes in after him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My name is Jack Harris. I believe we spoke on the phone earlier.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mr. Griffin, he just walked past. Frank waives her off. She walks out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm not going to change my position Mr. Harris. Your son committed a serious crime and although he's still a minor, the state of Texas will prosecute him to the full extent of the law.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Griffin, he's a kid. He dida stupid thing. I've severely reprimanded him for it. The school doesn't even want to press charges. Do we really need to go forward with this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris, let me lay this out for you. I've got people, voters, upstanding citizens, who I am responsible to. I have to answer to them.  100.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And these people want to see my son tried for this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well maybe the acorn didn't fall too far from the tree. Jack shifts in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So that's what this is all about? This is more about me than my son?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, we both know what you do for a living. You deal in pornography.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I run a billing company.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: But you still deal with pornography.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No more than any hotel chain. No more than any satellite or cable company. I'm just a middle man.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Look, I don't want to get into semantics. You're a pornographer. You peddle pornography over the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're getting off the subject. (a delicious beat) Let's focus on why we're here. Jack picks up his briefcase. He opens it. He drops a stack of fax material onto Frank's desk.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What's this? Jack picks up one of the sheets and reads.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Youngtightpussy.com. Splendorintheass.com. Blacksonblondes.com. This is your billing record, Mr. Griffin.  150 151 101. The blood drains from Frank's face. Jack then produces a manila envelope from his briefcase. It's stamped and addressed to the Houston Chronicle.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now God forbid this were to fall into the wrong hands and end up on the front page of tomorrow's paper. Can you imagine what that would do to a campaign in this nice, upstanding city? Especially to a man whose voter base is a bunch of good, God fearing Christian conservatives? I mean, that would be terrible. FREEZE FRAME: on Frank's face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Needless to say, the charges were dropped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Software Billing private jet pulls up to the terminal. INT. - DIANA’S CAR - DAY 151 Jack and Diana sit, watching the jet pull up. They are both incredibly tense.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: There’s a part of me that hates what you did to that man. But there is also a part of me that misses... She begins choking on her tears...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-being protected by you like that. I’m so lost right now...I’m so angry...and I’m so confused. Jack turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Diana...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Please, get out. Jack nods and gets out of the car.  152 153 154 102. INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES - DAY 152 Jack heads down the hallway to JOSH POSNER’s office, one of his engineers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t back in LA ten minutes before the shit hit the fan. INT. —- SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, JOSH’S OFFICE - DAY 153 Josh's office is scarce, except for a calendar on the wall. He sits in front of his computer with Jack looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: When I was looking for dirt on the DA I came across this website. It’s under Buck and Wayne’s domain, but it’s not billed by us.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s not billed by us? Then who the hell is it billed to?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: You're not gonna like this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Denny Z.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is bad.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: It gets worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne and Buck sit in the conference room with Robin Swallow and Alexandra Raynes. They talk business, but one has the feeling one of their films could break out any point.  103.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDRA
dialogues.text: We’ve found that the scenes where we are apart just do not hold the audience's attention.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: We want to start a new series of films called, Sixty nine from behind. Suddenly, Jack bursts into the room. He zeroes in on Buck and Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking minds?!? Before they can react, Jack jumps across the table. Wayne is the closest. Jack grabs him by the throat and begins choking the life out of him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Underage girls! Are you out of your fucking mind!?!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Relax Jack, relax! You're gonna kill him. Robin starts screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Jack releases his grip a bit on Wayne’s throat. Wayne fights to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: We were gonna tell you Jack, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just didn’t know how.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: We didn’t know that Denny Z fucked us, either! Jack shoves Wayne against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I don’t know.  155 156 104.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where the hell is he?!?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We hardly talk. Maybe at that house they shoot at in the Valley. Jack storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack screeches up in his Mercedes. We can hear thumping bass of the music coming from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters. The place is dark. Lights flash. Music is blasting. In the hallway, paces away, is a couple fucking. Jack stares. He steps around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack heads into the living room. It’s a tangle of flesh. Close to twenty people fucking in all positions in the darkness and intermittent light. It’s like Dante’s Inferno. Jack moves through the crowds of sexual partners. He moves to the dining room. Couples are on tables. Chairs. Up against walls. He moves through the kitchen. More fucking. Couples play with whipped cream. Jack moves past them and back into the hall. More couples fucking. Everywhere. Jack opens a bathroom door. Two chicks are sucking a guy off. The guy waives and gives Jack a thumbs up. Jack turns. He moves back through the kitchen. Jack moves across the living room again, over to the staircase. He steps over bodies on the stairs. He makes the turn and heads for a bedroom. Inside the bedroom, is a melee of fucking, drinking and drug use. A pile of cocaine on the night stand. Jack backs out slowly. Almost apologetically.  157 105. He crosses the bedroom. Down the stairs. Down the hall to the backyard. Through the door. Outside is Denny Z talking to two pornstars. Jack grabs Denny Z.

dialogues.speaker: DENNY Z
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell are you doing? Jack begins beating the shit out of him. He keeps hitting Denny until he’s a bloody pulp. Denny spits blood out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DENNY Z, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! I’1l fucking have you killed for this! Jack turns.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You'll do what? You’1l do what?!? Jack sees that Denny has a gun in his belt. Jack takes the gun away from Denny and fires a shot through Denny’s foot. Denny screams in agonizing pain. Jack tosses the gun and heads back into the house, leaving Denny screaming behind him. Jack goes back into the house. He heads back down the hall to the bottom of the staircase. Something catches his eye. He moves slowly back towards the living room. His face changes. It’s Audrey Dawn. She’s about to take on two guys in the middle of the floor. He stares. Jack leaves the house. INT. - JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT 157 Jack sits at the kitchen table, a glass of scotch in front of him...He's been drinking heavily and looks disheveled. Audrey enters the house and kicks off her shoes.  106.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Whew! Hard day at the office. Audrey heads towards the fridge. She pours herself a glass of wine and joins him at the table. Jack is incredibly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s up with you? Audrey sips her wine. She already know’s what’s up. Jack smiles...then LAUGHS almost maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I used to sit at a dinner table with my family.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Here we go...Is this old fashioned Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Old fashioned? You think families are old fashioned.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I think family is overrated. A bunch of people sharing the same name, professing their endless love while destroying each other's dreams.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You are one twisted chick, know that? But I guess you'd have to be to end up at that house tonight getting double teamed.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I told you a million times Jack, I don’t dig guilt. Fuck guilt. Look at you...You're all about leveraging guilt. Maybe if I’m good over here, I can be bad over here. It’s destroying you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Did it ever occur to you that maybe both of us have just switched off a part of our souls.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: And what part is that?  107.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The part that’s supposed to question this kind of behavior.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You're not going to start moralizing, are you? Jack, you’ve made all this money because of all the horny, frustrated guys out there who have to jerk off because their wives and girlfriends don’t treat them right. So I become their little fantasy girl for five minutes a pop, and make them forget for a fleeting instant that their wives and kids can’t stand the fucking sight of them. No, I’m not going to feel guilty about that and my soul is perfectly in fucking tact. Jack says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what I’m starting to think? I’m starting to think that you’re full of shit! I don't need to be here...I really don't. Why, so you can get a call in the middle of the night from your bitchy wife that one of your spoiled kids may not be able to take part in the local regatta at some prep school homecoming! I don't need that in my life! I don't need you!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Your bags are already packed, Audrey. Audrey stops. Tears fill her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Really?...Why?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We don't belong anywhere near each other.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: But...You make me happy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Happy? You have another word? Audrey's face contorts with sadness and rage. She then throws her wine glass at Jack's face. He blocks it, cutting his hand...  108.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Fine! Not the first time I've had my fucking bags packed ya' know!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And it won't be your last. Audrey heads inside, wheels out TWO SUITCASES.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Don't bother to help me you piece of shit. Your a real gentleman!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good news is, I won't feel guilty about it. She SCREAMS before heading out and SLAMMING THE DOOR so hard that one Jack's pictures falls off the mantle in the hallway and shatters. Jack gets up and walks to the hallway, locks the front door. On his way back he stops and picks up the broken picture frame... C.U. FRAME -- A younger Jack and Diana with their small children. Jack fights back his emotions...He walks with the broken picture out to his back deck...He takes a seat in a chair and just stares endlessly into the distant lights of San Pedro.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I came to the conclusion that I wanted out. I mean, desperately. I just didn’t know how. I caught myself doing something I hadn’t done in a long time. Praying. I was wondering if there was any good out there in the universe that could hear me, or if whoever it was decided a long time ago that I wasn’t worth listening to.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The sound of a ringing phone over black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack jumps up from his sleep, grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Allman walks to his car, on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: Jack, it’s, Allman. I need to see you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Can it wait till tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: It can’t wait an hour. Jack is taken a back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls into the lot. Allman is waiting for him, eating a hot dog by a long dock..

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Allman was already waiting for me. I couldn't wait to hear whatever good news the government might have for me now. Allman gets in Jack's car.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: You've been a stand up guy, Jack. As far as I’m concerned, the government owes you a lot. Two nights ago, several top ranking Terrorists were taken out in a fire fight in Afghanistan. Arrests were also made in Europe, Indonesia.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All told, nearly one hundred people rounded up...The least I could do, is warn you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Warn me about what?

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: The government knows about some underage girls on your websites.  110.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: No matter how you cut it, it’s child pornography, Jack. You'll be indicted, and trust me, you will go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I have nothing to do with that website.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: I believe you. I really do.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Alright. What do I do with this warning?

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: Get out. Now. As fast as possible. Jack stares at Allman.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I can't. Allman looks at Jack for a moment and then pulls out a folder and opens it. He holds various mugshot pictures of Ivan...Then Nikita and his Goons.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: Does it have anything to do with this? Jack stares at the PHOTOS and does everything he can to remain stoic.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One of your Ex bouncers was picked up on a drug charge two months ago. SINGLE SHOT: Peanut is cuffed against a car...

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He told us Ivan Sokoloff, nephew of Nikita Sokoloff, was murdered in your living room five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: 161 EXT. —- JACK’S CABIN CRUISER - NIGHT 161 Ivan’s body splashes down into the water.  162 163 111.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He said you dumped the body off the coast of Catalina.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've been in law enforcement a long time. I know when somebody's lying. His story was just a bit too linear for me to write off as bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna tell you what I think happened. I think you got involved in this business hoping to make a few bucks and get out quick. I think you partnered up with a bunch of lunatics who you can’t trust because they’ve got this thing hanging over your head. I’1l tell you the truth Jack, I really don’t give a shit that Ivan Sokoloff is dead. I think the world’s better off without him. I really don’t want to arrest you on this child porn thing Jack, but I'll be forced to do that if you don’t figure a quick way out of this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How the hell am I going to get out?

dialogues.speaker: ALLMAN
dialogues.text: That’s not my problem. You just need to get out. Jack thinks on this. Allman gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks in. He’s clearly at the end of his rope. EXT. - JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE, BALCONY - MORNING 163 Jack comes out onto the balcony, holding a half bottle of whiskey. He stares out as the sun rises over the harbor.  164 165 112.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was asking myself, how could things get any worse? Jack picks up his cell phone. INT. -— JACK'S HOUSTON HOUSE - MORNING 164 Diana is on the phone. She’s hysterical. Her eye is swollen. She barely makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! They took him! They took him!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What? Who? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Your friends! Your disgusting friends!

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - DAY 165 Several thugs wearing masks move through the house. Diana screams at the intruders.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was now pretty damn sure that Wayne and Buck had somehow told Nikita about Ivan. One of the thugs punches Diana out. They begin moving down the hall. Laura the maid grabs her son, Alejandro, and begins running down the hall to hide.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But put Buck and Wayne in charge of something, and of course things won't go the way they are supposed to. One of the thugs comes out from behind Laura and tackles her. He grabs Alejandro and hands him off to the other thugs. Laura screams and screams in Spanish. (LAURA: Por favor senior, dame mi hijo! Por favor! Por favor!)  166 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Russian thugs bring Alejandro into the hotel suite. Buck and Wayne stare at the kid, each other, then turn to the Russian thugs.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: This is boy.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah? So?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: This is boy from house.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah. This ain’t Jack’s kid. This kid’s a fucking Mexican! Right?

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: This isn’t Jack's kid! Look at him! He’s a fucking beaner, man!

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: What is beaner? This is boy from house.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (to kid) Do you speak English? Abla English kid? He doesn’t even speak English! You took the fucking maid’s kid! The Russian thugs look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: The maid! The maid! This is the maid’s kid!  167 168 169 170 114.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah! Jack's kid’s not a Mexican, right?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 167 Diana is on the phone with one of the Russian thugs. INT. -— HOUSTON BONAVENTURE HOTEL, ROOM - NIGHT 168

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN THUG
dialogues.text: If you want boy back, your husband is to deliver five million dollars. You go to police, we will kill boy and tell cops your husband killed a friend of ours. EXT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 169 Lightning flashes. It’s raining. This is how our story began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sits alone. Rain shadows dance across his face causing odd patterns on his cheeks. It’s as if the night cries the tears he cannot. Michael enters and approaches slowly.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You okay, daddy? Jack can’t speak. He just holds him tightly, runs his fingers through his hair. Then Jack lets go and cups his sons face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I need you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You keep an eye on mommy. She loves you, you got that?  171 172 173 174 115.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah...sure.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m serious...and you need to stay in school. I know it sounds corny, but trust me son, if you have an education, you're unstoppable. Michael nods, trying to take it all in. Jack hugs him again, kisses him, and heads out. INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 171 Jack zips the DUFFLE BAG. Diana holds Adam close to her. He looks to Diana.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get him back, Diana. INT. - JACK’S MERCEDES - NIGHT 172 A SERIES OF SILENT SHOTS...Jack's trip to meet for ransom is intercut with SHOTS of what could have been his life had he never left Houston... INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 173 Jack walks through the driving rain to his car. SINGLE SHOT: Jack with Diana and the kids on a beach...

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The ride was long enough for me to think about all that I did to get there...I thought about the years gone by, Diana, the kids...I pictured what my life would have been like had I never met Haggerty out in Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drives along the freeway towards the Bonaventure. SINGLE SHOT: Jack surveys his LA club...smiles. Business is good.  175 176 177 116.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I thought about love not money...I thought about what money used to mean to me. How I could have been just fine with the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack rides up in a glass elevator along the side of the building, overlooking the city. It’s all over his face. His thoughts are racing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I thought about big houses and how cold they are, how families need to pass each other once in a while in the hallway, families need to eat together at night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack moves down the hallway to the suite carrying the duffle bag. He pushes the door open. The door opens revealing a Russian THUG who lets Jack in. SINGLE SHOT: Jack's son Michael throws him a ball, he turns off the computer and goes outside with him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I thought about how underrated family is. INT. -— HOUSTON BONAVENTURE HOTEL, ROOM - NIGHT 177 The suite has lots of windows and glass, overlooking the city. Rain pounds against it as lightning intermittently lights up the room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I expected to see the Russians first. If not them, at least Buck and Wayne. But instead... Haggerty sits on the sofa puffing a huge Cuban cigar, blowing smoke rings. Jack takes a few steps forward and places the suitcase down.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why aren't I surprised?  117. Haggerty laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Because you’re a smart guy, Jack. And you always were a lucky guy, too. Until now. Now the luck runs out for you. (re: duffle bag) I take it that’s the money?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, let’s focus on why we’re here. You don’t get shit from me until that kid is well out of here.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Of course, of course. We’re not animals Jack. This is strictly business. The money’s not for me anyway Jack, it’s for him. Nikita moves over with two more thugs. He speaks in Russian to them. They open a bathroom door. Alejandro appears, spots Jack, and rushes over to him. He hugs Jack. Jack protectively brings him over to the door to the hall and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Go there (pointing to the HOTEL ROOM DOOR ACROSS THE HALL). You will be safe. Alejandro takes off across the hall where James opens the hotel room door. Jack shuts his door and goes back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for not hurting him. Jack takes the duffle bag and places it on the table. Nikita unzips it and does a quick count of the money.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: Why did you kill Ivan? Jack turns. Buck and Wayne are standing off in the corner. They look like two nervous school boys.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I didn’t kill him. It was an accident. Ask them. They were there.  118.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck that! We had nothing to do with it! That nigger bouncer punched him. Once. Right? He died.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He threatened my family. I didn’t want it to go down that way. I doubt that this helps, but I truly am sorry. Before Jack can get another word out, one of the thugs clocks Jack across the face, just like Ivan. Jack staggers back and falls to the floor. Nikita nods his satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Easy. We don’t want him signing these contracts under duress. Jack slowly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Did you say something about signing?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: That’s right. Jack looks around the room at everyone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Signing what? Haggerty gets up and moves over to the dining room table, where he produces a contract. He holds up a pen.

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack. Let’s get it over with. We gave you the kid, sign this and everybody's friends.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the hell am I signing?

dialogues.speaker: HAGGERTY
dialogues.text: Everything. Everything away to us. The business. To me, Nikita, Buck and Wayne. Jack stares at everyone in the room. Jack nods slowly. He moves over to the table and takes the pen from Haggerty.  119. Everyone gathers around as Jack signs his name. As he does, a drop of blood falls from Jack’s nose and lands on the paper. Nikita slowly raises his gun. Jack closes his eyes, awaiting his fate. Haggerty starts laughing. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) I can’t believe this! I mean, straight up, I just can’t believe this! I’ve been waiting and waiting for this moment. Haggerty turns to the wet bar, about to make a drink. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) I’m telling you shit, is finally going to turn around for old Jerry Hag...

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: Jack clinches his eyes tight, sweat beading down his forehead. Jerry turns back around to the group. Jerry's face starts to change. Blood starts to slowly spread across his chest. He knows something’s up, but it hasn't registered yet. Jack opens his eyes. Haggerty collapses into a heap on the floor. Jack stares. Buck and Wayne do the same, mouths open.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: A piece of shit like that couldn't be trusted. Nikita points the gun at Jack. Buck and Wayne react.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Oh no, hey please killing...please... »~no more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikita turns, pointing the gun at Buck and Wayne. Their attitudes change quickly.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: But better him than us, right? Nikita lowers the gun, looking back at Jack.  178 179 120.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA
dialogues.text: One has to choose his partners very carefully Mr. Harris, no? Jack doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: NIKITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You make good business for us all these years. And sometimes, business more important than family. Now get out. Jack nods, he moves for the door quickly and leaves. INT. — HOUSTON BONAVENTURE HOTEL, LOBBY - DAWN 178 Jack walks through the lobby, completely empty except for a janitor working a floor polisher. Jack sees Alejandro standing by the doorway with James. He smiles. He moves towards him, taking his hand. They walk through the sliding doors and exit the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Within six months, the FBI arrested everybody...everybody but me, of course... IMPOSE LEGEND: Six Months Later INT. — PRISON HOLDING CELL - DAY 179 Buck and Wayne, wearing orange jumpsuits, sit across from SOMEONE, talking a mile a minute. Their lawyers are also present.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: So then Jack forced us to go with him to dump the body.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. And he told us if we told anyone, he’d kill us, right!

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where did you dump the body?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I don’t know! In the ocean! The ocean's the ocean, right?  180 181 121.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For some reason, the government decided they didn’t have enough evidence to prosecute the case. The camera spins around to reveal the Someone as Allman. INT. — LAX, LUFTHANSA TERMINAL —- DAY 180 Nikita and a few of the Russian thugs pick up their tickets and head for the gate.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Russians, however, all jumped bail and disappeared back to the mother country.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: EXT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - MORNING 181 The rain has stopped and has swept the streets clean. Jack pulls up to the gate, and then drives up the driveway to the house. He gets out with Alejandro. Laura appears in the doorway, and they race towards one another. She hugs and kisses him. Jack watches from a distance. It’s clear that he feels like a stranger. Diana appears in the doorway. They lock eyes for a moment. He searches her eyes. Is there still hope? She moves back into the house. Her hand trails behind, wedding ring on. She leaves the door open. He takes that as a signal, and slowly heads towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Me? I‘1l do my best to put all of this behind me, if I can. That is, if life will allow me that opportunity... SWISH PAN: We race away from the house at high speed, over the wall, across the neighbor’s yard and whoosh into the second floor window. A guy, with his pants around his knees, is jerking off in front of his laptop. As he climaxes... ROLL CREDITS.
